tuv.seg: Registering the birth of your baby
Breith do linbh a chlárú
You will need to register the birth of your child no later than 3 months after their birth
Beidh ort breith do linbh a chlárú tráth nach déanaí ná trí mhí i ndiaidh go saolaítear é/í
Registration is a legal requirement in Ireland, but you will also need a birth certificate to enrol your child in school, to apply for a passport and for many other purposes

Anuas air sin, is ceanglas dlíthiúil atá i gclárúchán in Éirinn, ach teastóidh teastas breithe uait, chomh maith, chun do leanbh a chlárú i scoil, chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar phas agus ar go leor cuspóirí eile
(For Child Benefit, you will be contacted automatically as soon as you register the birth.)
(I dtaobh Sochar Linbh, déanfar teagmháil uathoibríoch leat a luaithe a chláraíonn tú an bhreith.)
The birth certificate will contain the information on the child and the parents that is given at the time of registration, so it is important that the information given is accurate
Cuimseofar sa teastas breithe an fhaisnéis faoin leanbh agus na tuismitheoirí a thugtar ag tráth an chlárúcháin, mar sin, tá sé tábhachtach go bhfuil an fhaisnéis a thugtar cruinn
It is difficult to change the details after the initial registration
Is deacair sonraí a athrú i ndiaidh an chlárúcháin tosaigh
(See 'Correction of errors' below.)
(Féach ‘Ceartú earráidí’ thíos.)
If the parents of a child are not married to each other, there is no presumption in law as to who the father of the child is, unless the father's name is on the birth certificate
Mura bhfuil tuismitheoirí linbh pósta lena chéile, níl aon toimhde ann sa dlí maidir le cé hé athair an linbh, murach go bhfuil ainm an athar ar an teastas breithe
You can read more about establishing paternity in the document Presumption of paternity
Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a léamh faoi atharthacht a dheimhniú sa cháipéis Toimhde atharthachta
The Civil Registration Act 2004 changed some of the rules about registering a birth
D’athraigh an tAcht um Chlárú Sibhialta, 2004 cuid de na rialacha faoi bhreith a chlárú
The Act also provides for them to apply for a certified copy of an entry in the Register of Gender Recognition
D’fhoilsigh an Rialtas an Bille um Inscne a Aithint, 2014 (pdf)
A certificate issued from the Register of Gender Recognition is the equivalent of a birth certificate and satisfies all requirements where a person is asked to provide a birth certificate
Déantar foráil sa Bhille go ndéanfaidh duine iarratas ar theastas nua breithe ar a sonrófar a n-inscne
A birth may be registered in the office of any Registrar of Births, Marriages and Deaths, regardless of where it took place
Féadtar breith a chlárú in oifig aon Chláraitheoir Breitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna, gan aird ar an áit ar tharla an bhreith
The staff of the hospital where your child was born, or of your local health centre, will be able to tell you where you can register the birth
Beidh foireann an ospidéil inar rugadh do leanbh, nó foireann d’ionaid áitiúil sláinte, in ann thú a chur ar an eolas cá féidir leat an bhreith a chlárú
The birth should be registered not later than 3 months after the date of the birth
Ba cheart go mbeadh an bhreith cláraithe tráth nach déanaí ná trí mhí i ndiaidh dháta na breithe

A Birth Notification Form (Form BNF/01) is usually completed with the parent(s) by hospital staff (in the case of hospital births) or by a doctor or midwife (in home births) to guarantee that correct and accurate information is recorded

Is gnách go gcomhlánaíonn foireann an ospidéil Foirm um Fhógra Breithe (Foirm BNF/01) leis an tuismitheoir/na tuismitheoirí (i gcás breitheanna ospidéil) nó ag dochtúir nó ag bean chabhrach (i gcás breitheanna sa bhaile) lena chinntiú go gcuirtear an fhaisnéis cheart agus chruinn i gcuntas
This form outlines the information to be recorded in the Register of Births
Tugtar cuntas san fhoirm seo ar an bhfaisnéis atá le cur i dtaifead i gClár na mBreitheanna
The form is forwarded to the Registrar's office letting the Registrar know that a birth has occurred
Seolfar an fhoirm ar aghaidh go dtí oifig an Chláraitheora agus cuirfidh sí an Cláraitheoir ar an eolas gur tharla an bhreith
This is not enough, however, to register the birth
Ní leor seo, áfach, chun an bhreith a chlárú
The registration of the birth is carried out based on information provided by a qualified informant who is required to attend at the office of the Registrar to sign the Register of Births
Tugtar faoi chlárú na breithe bunaithe ar an bhfaisnéis a sholáthraíonn faisnéiseoir cáilithe ar gá dó/di freastal ar Oifig an Chláraitheora chun Clár na mBreitheanna a shíniú
The mother and father of the child are the main qualified informants and, where possible, must attend personally for the registration of the birth
Is iad máthair agus athair an linbh na príomhfhaisnéiseoirí agus, sa chás gur féidir, ní mór dóibh freastal go pearsanta ar chlárú na breithe
They must bring photo identification, for example a passport or driving licence, and their Personal Public Service Numbers (PPS Number)
Ní mór dóibh aitheantas grianghraif a thabhairt leo, mar shampla, pas nó ceadúnas tiomána, agus a nUimhreacha Pearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí (UPSP)
In some cases, for example where a mother has been married previously, additional material may be required and they are advised to contact the Civil Registration Service to find out more

I roinnt cásanna, mar shampla, sa chás go raibh máthair pósta roimhe seo, d’fhéadfadh breis ábhair bheith ag teastáil agus moltar dóibh teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an tSeirbhís um Chlárú Sibhialta chun teacht ar bhreis sonraí
If the parents are in a recognised marriage only one parent need attend, however, if both wish to sign the register they should both attend
Má tá na tuismitheoirí i bpósadh aitheanta, ní gá ach do thuismitheoir amháin freastal, ach más mian leis an mbeirt an clárú a shíniú, áfach, ba cheart don bheirt díobh freastal
If the parents were married in another country, they should bring the original marriage certificate and a translation if required
Má bhí na tuismitheoirí pósta i dtír eile, ba cheart dóibh an bundeimhniú pósta agus a aistriúchán, má theastaíonn, a thabhairt leo
Where the parents do not register the birth, or it is not possible for them to do it, the following individuals can also act as qualified informants:
Sa chás nach gcláraíonn na tuismitheoirí an bhreith, nó nach féidir leo é sin a dhéanamh, féadfaidh na daoine aonair a leanas gníomhú mar fhaisnéiseoirí cáilithe
• A designated member of the staff of the hospital (or other institution, organisation or enterprise) where the birth took place
• Comhalta ainmnithe foirne an ospidéil (nó institiúid, eagraíocht nó fiontar eile), áit ar thit an bhreith amach
• Any person present at the birth
• Aon duine a bhí i láthair ag an mbreith
• Any person present in the dwelling where the birth occurred
• Aon duine a bhí i láthair san áit chónaithe, áit ar tharla an bhreith
• Any person who has charge of the child
• Aon duine atá i gceannas ar an leanbh
• A person appointed guardian of the child
• Duine a ceapadh mar chaomhnóir an linbh
• A person found to be the parent of the child by order of the courts
• Duine a dheimhnítear bheith mar thuismitheoir an linbh ag ordú na gcúirteanna
The following information is recorded in the Register of Births:
Cuirtear an fhaisnéis a leanas i dtaifead i gClár na mBreitheanna:

The surname registered must be the surname of the father or mother or both. If you want your child to have a surname other than the surname of the father or mother or both, then an application must be made to the Registrar General or a Superintendent Registrar in writing

• Sloinne an linbh Ní mór gurbh ionann an sloinne atá á chlárú agus sloinne an athar nó na máthar nó sloinnte na beirte acu Más mian leat go mbeidh sloinne eile, seachas sloinne an athar nó na máthar nó na beirte acu, ar an leanbh, ní mór iarratas a dhéanamh ar an Ard-Chláraitheoir nó ar an bPríomh-Chláraitheoir i scríbhinn
• Time, date and place of birth of the child
• Am, dáta agus áit bhreithe an linbh
• Personal Public Service Number (PPS Number) of the child (allocated at registration)
• Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí (Uimhir PSP) an linbh (a leithdháiltear ar chlárú)
• Forename(s) and surname of the child
• Céadainm(neacha) agus sloinne an linbh
• Forename(s) and surname of the mother
• Céadainm(neacha) agus sloinne na máthar
• Birth surname of the mother
• Sloinne breithe na máthar
• All previously used surnames of the mother (if any)
• Gach sloinne na máthar a úsáideadh roimhe seo (más ann dóibh)
• The mother's normal address at the date of birth
• Gnáthsheoladh na máthar ag dáta na breithe
• The mother's date of birth
• Dáta breithe na máthar
• The mother's marital status
• Stádas pósta na máthar
• The mother's Personal Public Service Number (PPS Number)
• Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí na máthar (Uimhir PSP)
• Birth surname of the mother's mother
• Sloinne breithe mháthair na máthar
• Similar information is entered for the father
• Iontráiltear a mhacasamhail d’fhaisnéis don athair
There are different options for registration, including the father's details, where the mother and father are not married
Tá roghanna éagsúla ann do chlárúchán, lena n-áirítear sonraí an athar, sa chás nach bhfuil an mháthair agus an t-athair pósta
(The forms used are available from the Registrar's office.) The options are as follows:
(Tá na foirmeacha a úsáidtear ar fáil ó Oifig an Chláraitheora.) Is iad seo a leanas na roghanna:
• Both the mother and father can jointly request the registration (Form CRA 9)
• Féadfaidh an mháthair agus an t-athair an clárúchán a chomhiarraidh (Foirm CRA 9)
Both attend the Registrar's office together and sign the register jointly
Freastalaíonn an bheirt acu ar Oifig an Chláraitheora i dteannta a chéile agus comhshíníonn siad an clár
• The mother can complete a declaration form naming the father (Form CRA 1) and bring it, along with a declaration by the baby's father acknowledging that he is the father of the child (Form CRA 3)

• Féadfaidh an mháthair foirm dhearbhaithe a chomhlánú ina n-ainmnítear an t-athair (Foirm CRA 1) agus an fhoirm a thabhairt léi, mar aon le dearbhú ag athair an linbh a aithníonn gurb é athair an linbh (Foirm CRA 3)
The mother signs the register
Síníonn an mháthair an clár

• The father may complete a declaration form acknowledging that he is the father of the child (Form CRA 2) , and may go to the Registrar's office himself, bringing with him a declaration by the mother naming the father (Form CRA 4)

• Féadfaidh an t-athair foirm dhearbhaithe a chomhlánú a aithníonn gurb é athair an linbh (Foirm CRA 2), agus féadfaidh sé cuairt a thabhairt ar Oifig an Chláraitheora é féin, agus dearbhú ag an máthair a thabhairt leis a ainmníonn é féin mar athair an linbh (Foirm CRA 4)
The father signs the register
Síníonn an t-athair an clár
• The mother or father may make a written request (Form CRA 5 and Form CRA 6 respectively) on production of a certified copy of a court order which names the person to be registered as the father

• Féadfaidh an mháthair nó an t-athair iarratas scríofa (Foirm CRA 5 agus Foirm CRA 6, faoi seach) a dhéanamh nuair a sholáthraítear cóip dheimhnithe d’ordú cúirte, a ainmníonn an duine atá le clárú mar an t-athair
The parent making the request will be required to attend at the office of the Registrar to sign the Register of Births
Beidh ar thuismitheoir a dhéanann an t-iarratas freastal ar Oifig an Chláraitheora chun Clár na mBreitheanna a shíniú
It is also possible to enter the father's details if the mother is or was married to someone else
Anuas air sin, is féidir sonraí an athar a iontráil má tá nó mó bhí an mháthair pósta le duine eile
As well as a sworn declaration from the father stating he is the father, one of the following is required:
Mar aon le dearbhú faoi mhionn ón athair ina luaitear gurb é an t-athair, teastaíonn ceann amháin díobh seo a leanas chomh maith:
• A sworn declaration by the mother's husband stating he is not the father, or
• Dearbhú faoi mhionn ag fear céile na máthar ina luaitear nach é an t-athair, nó

• A sworn delaration by the mother stating she has been living apart from her husband for more than 10 months before the birth of the child and a deed of separation/decree of divorce (not all foreign divorces are recognised under Irish law), or

• Dearbhú faoi mhionn ag an máthair ina luaitear go raibh sí ina cónaí amach óna fear céile ar feadh breis agus 10 mí roimh bhreith an linbh mar aon le gníomhas idirscartha/foraithne cholscartha (ní aithnítear gach colscaradh iasachta faoi dhlí na hÉireann), nó
• A certified copy of a court order which names the person to be registered as the father
• Cóip dheimhnithe d’ordú cúirte ina n-ainmnítear an duine atá le clárú mar an t-athair
A leaflet on Birth Registration of Children (pdf) is available on Treoir's website
Tá fáil ar bhileog ar Chlárú Breithe Leanaí (pdf) ar láithreán gréasáin Treoir
A birth can only be re-registered:
Ní féidir breith a athchlárú ach :
• If the parents of a child are not married to each other but wish to have the father's details included and these details were not registered initially, or
• Mura bhfuil tuismitheoirí linbh pósta lena chéile ach más mian leo sonraí an athar a chur san áireamh agus murar cláraíodh na sonraí seo i dtosach, nó
• If the parents of a child marry each other after the birth of the child
• Má phósann tuismitheoirí linbh a chéile i ndiaidh bhreith an linbh
The child's surname can be changed at the joint request of both parents when re-registering the birth
Is féidir sloinne an linbh a athrú ach ar chomhiarratas na beirte tuismitheoirí nuair a bhíonn an bhreith á clárú
Contact the Civil Registration Service to find out what documentation and information is required
Déan teagmháil leis an tSeirbhís um Chlárú Sibhialta lena dheimhniú cén cháipéisíocht agus faisnéis a theastaíonn
Under Section 25 of the Civil Registration Act 2004, parents can apply to have their child’s forename registered, added or changed
Faoi Alt 25 den Acht um Chlárú Sibhialta 2004, is féidir le tuismitheoirí iarratas a dhéanamh go bhfuil túsainm linbh cláraithe, chuirtear nó athrú
Contact the Civil Registration Service to find out what documentation is required
Déan teagmháil leis an tSeirbhís um Chlárú Sibhialta a fháil amach cad doiciméadú atá ag teastáil
A birth certificate cannot be amended unless there are valid reasons to do so
Ní féidir teastas breithe a leasú mura bhfuil cúiseanna bailí ann chun amhlaidh a dhéanamh
Information on when amendments can be made and what you have to do is available on the General Registrar's website
Tá faisnéis ar fáil ar cathain is féidir leasuithe a dhéanamh agus ar an méid is gá duit a dhéanamh, ar láithreán gréasáin an Ard-Chláraitheora
If you have adopted a baby, whether from Ireland or overseas, registration will be processed by the Adoption Authority
Má d’uchtaigh tú leanbh, cibé acu ó Éirinn nó ó áit thar lear, próiseálfaidh an tÚdarás Uchtála an clárúchán
For further information, please see Adopting a child and Inter-country adoptions
Chun teacht ar a thuilleadh faisnéise, féach Leanbh a uchtú agus Uchtuithe idir thíortha
There is no fee charged for the registration of a birth, or for re-registration to include a parent's details
Ní ghearrtar aon táille ar bhreith a chlárú, nó ar bhreith a athchlárú chun sonraí tuismitheora a chur san áireamh
There is a fee of €5 for insertion or alteration of a child's forename
Gearrtar táille €5 ar túsainm linbh a iontráil nó a athrú
A birth certificate is issued for social welfare purposes at a reduced cost
Eisítear teastas breithe ar mhaithe le cuspóirí leasa shóisialaigh ar chostas laghdaithe
Evidence it is for social welfare purposes is required, such as a note from the Department of Social Protection
Teastaíonn fianaise a chruthaíonn go bhfuil an teastas ar mhaithe le cuspóirí leasa shóisialaigh, ar nós nóta ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí

Since 19 December 2016, at the time of registration there is no charge for a birth certificate for a deceased child if the deceased child was less than 12 months of age on the date of death and the birth and death are registered at the same time

Ó 19 Nollaig 2016, má bhí an leanbh éagtha faoin bhun 12 mhí aois ar dháta báis agus má chláraítear an bhreith agus an bás ag an am ceana, ní aon táille do theastas breithe do leanbh éagtha ag tráth an chlárúcháin
The fees for a certificate are:
Is iad na táillí atá ar theastas:
• €20 for a full standard certificate
• €20 ar theastas iomlán caighdeánach
• €1 for a copy for social welfare purposes (letter from Department of Social Protection required)
• €1 ar chóip den teastas ar mhaithe le cuspóirí leasa shóisialaigh (teastaíonn litir ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí)
• €4 for an uncertified copy of an entry in the Register
• €4 ar chóip neamhdheimhnithe d’iontráil sa Chlár
• €10 to have a certificate authenticated (only available from the General Register Office)
• €10 go bhfíordheimhneofar teastas (níl seo ar fáil ach ó Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora)
The birth should be registered not later than 3 months after the date of the birth
Conas iarratas a dhéanamh
To obtain a copy of a birth certificate at a later stage, you can go directly to any Registrar's office
Chun cóip de theastas breithe a fháil, féadfaidh tú dul díreach a fhad le hOifig aon Chláraitheora
Alternatively, you can apply by post, stating the child's full names, date and place of birth, and enclosing a cheque or postal order for the relevant fees in euro

Mar mhalairt air sin, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh tríd an bpost, agus ainmneacha iomlána, dáta agus áit bhreithe an linbh a lua, agus seic nó ordú poist a chur faoi iamh do na táillí ábhartha in euro
Adopted children's birth certificates are only available from the General Register Office
Níl teastais bhreithe linbh uchtaithe ar fáil ach ó Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora
Download an application form for a birth certificate here
Íoslódáil foirm iarratais ar theastas breithe anseo
This application form is also available from the General Register Office
Tá an fhoirm iarratais seo ar fáil, chomh maith, ó Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora
You can also apply online for a copy of a certificate, including domestic adoptions and stillbirths that have been registered
Ina theannta sin, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar líne ar theastas, lena n-áirítear uchtuithe teaghlaigh agus marbh-bhreitheanna a cláraíodh
Since 5 December 2005 a birth may be registered in the office of any Registrar of Births, Marriages and Deaths
Ón 5 Nollaig 2005 i leith, féadtar breith a chlárú in oifig aon Chláraitheora Breitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna
You can view contact information for registrars here
Féadfaidh tú féachaint ar fhaisnéis teagmhála do chláraitheoirí anseo
